pullrequest.title: Only check major.minor when comparing two versions of gazebo

content.raw:
ah that's a good point that it's not actually quitting if they don't match! I saw this error when I couldn't get a client and server connect for a different reason (`GAZEBO_IP` on server was set to `127.0.0.1`), and figured (because of the error message) that the reason they weren't connecting was because of version mismatch. 

Would either of these make sense to prevent this confusion from happening in the future? (Depends if the protobuf messages change between minors, which I'm not sure about)

1. Change the error to a warning (appropriate if different minor versions *might* not actually talk)

1. Change to just comparing majors (appropriate if versions with diff minors are *always* expected to talk). Probably still appropriate to change the error to a warning since it's not actually quitting?

I saw this error when I couldn't get a client and server connect for a different reason (GAZEBO_IP on server was set to 127.0.0.1), and figured (because of the error message) that the reason they weren't connecting was because of version mismatch.

Would either of these make sense to prevent this confusion from happening in the future? (Depends if the protobuf messages change between minors, which I'm not sure about)

  1. Change the error to a warning (appropriate if different minor versions might not actually talk)

  2. Change to just comparing majors (appropriate if versions with diff minors are always expected to talk). Probably still appropriate to change the error to a warning since it's not actually quitting?
